level_name: Into The World of Social Media

assistant.text: Hello! I'm your personal assistant. And I will introduce you into the world of social media!

Before you can do anything on social media, you need to create an account.

For that you need a username and a password.

Don't worry. That is why I am here.

A username is the name you choose for your account. It can be your real name or a nickname.
It is public and everyone can see it. Have that in mind when you choose a username.

Next is the password. It is a secret code that you need to enter to log in to your account.

It is important that you choose a strong password.
I will show you how a strong password should look like.

Have a look at the text above.
That are some general easy to follow rules for strong and save password.

If something is not clear, just ask me by clicking the button with the questionmark for the according item.

data.title: Password Security
data.description: That's how a password should look like

items.text: Use at least eight characters. The longer the better (as long as you can remember it!).
items.explanation:
A strong password should be at least eight characters long.

That is because it is harder to guess a longer password.

items.text: Make it memorable, but avoid using personal information like names or birthdays.
items.explanation:
A strong password should be memorable, so that you don't have to write it somewhere.

But if you include personal information like your name in it it is easier to guess.
And we definalty don't want that.

items.text: Use a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, symbols and numbers.
items.explanation:
Use a mix of upper and lower case letters, numbers and special characters.

That is because it is harder to guess such passwords.

items.text: R3pl@ce le++ers wit# sYmb0ls and n^mb3rs 1ike thi$.
items.explanation:
You can replace letters with numbers or special characters that look the same.

For example: 'e' can be replaced with '3' and 'a' can be replaced with '@'.

With that you can easily add hard to guess symbols to you password, but they are still easy to remeber for you.

items.text: Do not use the same password on multiple sites.
items.explanation:
Don't use the same password for multiple accounts.

If someone gets access to one of your accounts, he can use the same password to get access to all your accounts.

items.text: Do not use personal information (name, address, birth dates or even a pet's name, etc.) in your password.
items.explanation:
Dont include personal information like your name, birthday or address in your password.

That is because it is easier to guess such passwords.

items.text: Do not use a password that is easy to guess (like "password", "123456", "qwerty", etc.).
items.explanation:
Don't use easy and commonly used passwords.

Attackers use programs that try to guess passwords by using common words and numbers.

items.text: Do not use a password that can be found in a dictionary.
items.explanation:
Try to avoid using passwords that can be found in a dictionary.

Attackers use programs that try to guess passwords by using words from dictionaries.

items.text: Do not share your password with anyone.
items.explanation:
Never share your password with anyone.

If you do that, they can use your account and do whatever they want. Even if you trust them, you should never share your password with anyone.

items.text: Do not write your password down.
items.explanation:
Never write your password down.

If you do that, someone else can find it and use your account.

If your password is really hard to remember, you can use a password manager to save it.
